title: Holographic M-Brane Super-Embeddings
authors: Grigorios Giotopoulos, Hisham Sati, Urs Schreiber
abstract:
Over a decade before the modern formulation of AdS/CFT duality, Duff et al.
had observed a candidate microscopic explanation by identifying the CFT fields
with fluctuations of probe p-branes stretched out in parallel near the horizon
of their own black brane incarnation. A profound way to characterize these and
more general probe p-brane configurations, especially for M5-branes, is
expected to be as "super-embeddings" of their super-worldvolumes into target
super-spacetime - but no concrete example of these had appeared in the
literature.
  Here we fill this gap by constructing the explicit holographic
super-embedding of probe M5-branes and M2-branes into their corresponding
super-AdS backgrounds. The result seems to be novel and shows that the
holographic M-probes, static with respect to the Poincar\'e chart, must sit
exactly at the throat radius.
